clinical_study.brief_title: Dietary Therapy in Children With Refractory Epilepsy
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Modified Atkins Diet Versus Ketogenic Diet in Children With Refractory Epilepsy Aged 1 Year to 18 Years: a Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi

clinical_study.source: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi

brief_summary.textblock: In children aged 1yr -18 years with refractory epilepsy Modified Atkins diet as add on to ongoing AED therapy would not be inferior compared to ketogenic diet ** in terms of seizure reduction from baseline seizure frequency at 6 months

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary objective:
To compare the efficacy of Modified Atkins diet compared to Ketogenic diet * in children aged 1 year to 18 years of age with refractory epilepsy on anti epileptic drugs at 6 months of diet intake in terms of percentage of seizure reduction from base line.
Secondary objective:
Proportion of patients who achieve > 50% seizure reduction from baseline after 6 months in both groups To evaluate the nature of adverse events in both the groups

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of seizure reduction at 6 months ( sz frequency / wk average of 4 wks) from base line
primary_outcome.description: To develop an optimal dietary therapy for management of refractory epilepsy in children and adolescents

intervention.description: Minimum ratio (2.5 to4:1) ketogenic diet causing ketosis will be given
1:1 fixed ketogenic ratio Modified atkins diet will be given

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged 1-18 years with refractory epilepsy*
- Willing to come for regular follow up
- No motivational or psychosocial issues in the family which would preclude compliance with the diet
Exclusion Criteria
- Surgically remediable cause for refractory epilepsy
- Suspected mitochondrial disorder or diagnosed with a disorder in which high fat diet is contraindicated
- Previously received ketogenic diet or modified Atkins diet
- Chronic systemic disease like chronic kidney disease, chronic liver disease, heart disease (congenital and acquired) and chronic respiratory illness
